title: Hillel the Elder
summary: Hillel (Hebrew: הִלֵּל‎ Hīllēl; variously called Hillel HaGadol, Hillel HaZaken, Hillel HaBavli[1] or HaBavli,[2] was born according to tradition in Babylon c. 110 BCE, died 10 CE[3] in Jerusalem) was a Jewish religious leader, sage and scholar associated with the development of the Mishnah and the Talmud and the founder of the House of Hillel school of tannaim.
